alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 6:50PM MST until January 13 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches for southeast portions of Flathead Lake, with locally up to 5 inches. For the Wind Chill Warning, extreme cold. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Mission Valley, Flathead Lake, Polson, and Flathead Valley. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. During lake effect snow, the weather can vary from bands of locally heavy snow to dry weather just a few miles away. Visibilities can also vary greatly. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather, visibility, and road conditions.
